alert.note: Alert for Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 16 at 5:06AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...Blowing Snow and Periods of Moderate Snow for the Seward Highway... Motorists traveling through Portage Valley and into Whittier should expect moderate snow this afternoon and evening. A developing front will push into Prince William Sound as we head through the day. Along with steady snow, this system will bring some gusty easterly winds with it. Winds could gust as high as 25 mph. Initially the snow will start out light and fluffy before transitioning to a wetter consistency. Thus, the snow will be easily transported by the winds and other vehicles. Visibility as low as one half mile will be possible at times. Snow amounts will generally range from 3 to 7 inches, with the highest amounts closer to Whittier. The period of worst conditions looks to be from around 1pm AKST to about 7pm AKST. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
